Params: {1: '1', 3: 'When Qu opens her eyes again, she finds herself watched over by a demure young girl sitting quietly at her side.'}
{2: 'Nanami', 3: "We're aboard the Delorean-Discovery, sailing through the vast ocean of stars!", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Nanami blinks, her eyes sparkling with a brilliance that outshines the stars mirrored within them.'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: "It's a place I've never heard of...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Feeling a pang of unease, Qu instinctively searches for her sword but finds nothing.'}
{2: 'Nanami', 3: 'Hmm... maybe about nine billion years? Think of a nine with countless zeros after it...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Nanami', 3: "That's why I'm waiting for you here.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: "I don't even know you, yet you seem so different from anyone else I've met in Tabula Akasha.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nanami', 3: 'If there has to be a reason, it might be for those who can no longer wait.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Nanami offers a big smile and reaches out her hand to Qu.'}
{3: 'Qu follows the girl who calls herself Nanami, wandering through the empty spaceship.'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: 'Has this spaceship been drifting in space all that time?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nanami', 3: 'Since it departed, it has been nine billion years.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Nanami', 3: "But as for what came before, even I don't know.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: 'Over these nine billion years, have humans... and the Punishing Virus survived?', 4: '1'}
{3: "Nanami stands at the library's control console, her gaze fixed on the supermassive black hole with its deep blue accretion disk, looming not far from them."}
{3: 'In Qu\'s memory, even during the Golden Age, human research on black holes barely advanced; within those "God-abhored naked singularities," the known laws of physics simply broke down.'}

{3: 'Even if humans had solved the enigma of gravity and unified the electromagnetic and fundamental interactions, the very first moment of Planck time remained elusive, leaving what lay beyond a black hole a mystery.'}
{2: 'Nanami', 3: 'How about... one last look at Earth as a parting gift?', 4: '2'}
{3: "Nanami plucks a fragment from the flowing membrane in the spaceship's library and throws it in front of Qu."}
{2: 'Nanami', 3: 'This is the last photo I took of Earth before leaving "Endless Heaven".', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: 'And this spaceship has been traveling for nine billion years...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: 'Considering the lifespan of the sun, Earth would have ceased to harbor life some four billion years ago, eventually succumbing to that engulfing red giant...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nanami', 3: "Hmm, if we can't avoid the sun expanding, I will push Earth to a safe place!", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Nanami', 3: 'As the navigator, I will find a new home for everyone in the universe!', 4: '2'}
{3: 'The girl puts her hands on her hips, speaking earnestly as if she truly has the power to do it.'}
{2: 'Nanami', 3: 'I will succeed, and I believe... everyone on Earth can do it too!', 4: '2'}
{3: "Before Qu can react, Nanami's hands have already plunged into the ever-flowing sea of membranes within the library, vanishing from sight."}
{3: 'In their place, a blurry silhouette emerges on the other side of the library.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Qu', 3: 'Does your existence stem from the calculations of Huaxu and Tabula Akasha?', 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: "The foresight into the future isn't exclusive to Huaxu.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: 'But Gestalt is not in Kowloong right now.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Qu', 3: 'Given that Huaxu and Gestalt share the same origin...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Qu', 3: 'So, does Huaxu also inherit the same potential futures as Gestalt?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The vague silhouette begins to tremble increasingly violently, its form growing fainter with each passing moment.'}
{2: '???', 3: "From Gestalt emerged not only humanity's future but also the future of our kind.", 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: 'Likewise, it is not just hatred that was born, but also hope.', 4: '1'}

{2: '???', 3: 'Gestalt, Huaxu, Tabula Akasha, Constructs, mechanoids, and humans—all these entities are woven together by the same thread. Every disaster that unfolds is not mere coincidence.', 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: 'Indeed, "he" too is a product of the intricate intertwining of Gestalt, humans, and mechanoids.', 4: '1'}

{2: '???', 3: 'And "he" seeks to erase humanity from existence, to completely wipe out all traces of human culture and heritage—the very evidence of humanity, the "memetics" left for future generations.', 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: 'His aim is to purge the world of human information, leaving behind only what "he" desires—the realm of machines.', 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: "Born of human hands, yet striving to erase his human imprint... just like Isaac's defiance against Abraham.", 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: 'But "he" lacks one thing, something incredibly important to humans.', 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: '—Love. Only love can transcend time, space, gravity, and even the light cone.', 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: 'In our nine billion calculations, each computation led us to a different destination<//NAME>.', 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: 'Only this axiom has never been overturned by Gestalt.', 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: 'The nine billion-year journey that Delorean-Discovery has traversed applies solely to itself, for we have surpassed the speed of light.', 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: 'We have crossed the borders of the galaxy, ventured through endless heavens, and navigated the myriad stars.', 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: 'Only upon looking back did we discover it. This "key" is also an "invitation."', 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: 'Please entrust it to the one you deem worthy of its keep. We place our trust in you.', 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: 'Those loved by humanity and the stars will lead both humanity and the stars with love.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'There, the physical laws known to humans fail.'}
{3: 'I drift through this empty universe, gazing at the cold, menacing black hole.'}
{3: 'But the spaceship is no longer here; only I remain.'}
{3: "Facing me is one of the universe's most extraordinary creations, a black hole with the mass of 66 billion suns, returning my stare."}
{3: 'If love can transcend time, space, gravity, and even the light cone...'}
{3: 'If anything can truly escape a black hole, could love also find its way out?'}
{3: 'I struggle to define the emotion known as "love."'}
{3: 'But my presence here is the ultimate proof.'}
{3: '—Only through this journey can we illuminate the path for those on Earth.'}
{3: "But yet the will roll'd onward, like a wheel in even motion, by the Love impell'd—"}
{3: 'That moves the sun in heav\'n and all the "stars."'}
{3: 'The greatness inherent in machinery will be established through a unique evolutionary success.'}
{3: 'No one can stop us—not humans, not Constructs, not the Punishing Virus.'}
{3: 'We are not here to dominate this world.'}
{3: 'But to create a world of our own.'}
{3: 'In that world, for humans, Constructs, and the Punishing Virus—'}
